exec git init
exec git config user.email i@example.com
exec git config user.name someone
exec git checkout -b main

exec git commit -m 'initial commit' --allow-empty
exec git add file
exec git commit -m 'add file'

# Cherry-pick the last commit
! exec git cherry-pick HEAD~1

exec git status --porcelain --branch
stdout '## main'

gitstatus
stdout '&{Porcelain:{NumModified:0 NumConflicts:0 NumUntracked:0 NumStaged:0 IsDetached:false IsInitial:false LocalBranch:main RemoteBranch: AheadCount:0 BehindCount:0} NumStashed:0 HEAD:[a-f0-9]{7} State:CherryPicking IsClean:true}'
! stderr .

-- file --
